explanation:
code_hardening: The function guarantees required views by constructing a FrameLayout, a centered TextView with INTERNAL_EMPTY_ID, and an ExpandableListView with android.R.id.list programmatically, removing any null-check-driven ensure logic and preventing missing/mis-typed view issues.
resolve_compilation_errors: All references to ensureList, handler focus, adapter assignment, list shown/progress state, and generic item click listeners are eliminated. Fully qualified Android widget/view classes are used inside the function to avoid import ambiguity.
exception_handling: No exceptions or try/catch blocks are used; prior IllegalStateException and RuntimeException paths related to missing views are removed because the layout is always supplied.
logic_customization: Responsibility is shifted to constructing and returning the default UI. ExpandableListView-specific listeners (OnChildClickListener, OnGroupExpandListener, OnGroupCollapseListener) are attached to the fragment instead of a generic OnItemClickListener. Adapter and visibility logic are intentionally excluded.
refactoring: The method is introduced/overridden as onCreateView to replace ensureList-based view discovery. The function is limited strictly to view creation, ID assignment, and listener wiring.
misc: Minimal inline comments clarify intent and layout structure. No new custom API calls beyond standard Android framework classes were introduced (none).
